content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

**1. What is the Current Market Regime?**
RISK-ON: low volatility (Vol: 21.2%) and broad participation (Breadth: 6/8 sectors positive) driving risk appetite. Market profile favors cyclicals and carry into names with confirmed 1W and 1M strength.

**2. Which sectors are leading?**
Construction & REIT and Transportation are leading; Construction & REIT highlighted by TKFEN (1W: +11.99% | 1M: +17.36%) ABOVE TREND and ALARK (1W: +8.77% | 1M: +12.64%) ABOVE TREND. Transportation led by THYAO (1W: +7.77% | 1M: +13.04%) ABOVE TREND and TAVHL (1W: +6.15% | 1M: +12.76%) ABOVE TREND.

**3. Which sectors are lagging?**
Banking & Finance and Holding & Investment are lagging on the week, showing dispersion within the group; AKBNK (1W: -6.05% | 1M: +15.79%) CORRECTION and GARAN (1W: -1.81% | 1M: +8.04%) CORRECTION lead the downside. Holding names SAHOL (1W: -2.50% | 1M: +15.55%) CORRECTION and DOHOL (1W: -2.33% | 1M: +13.27%) CORRECTION are also underperforming.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

**4. Top Performing Stocks?**
TKFEN (1W: +11.99% | 1M: +17.36%) ABOVE TREND; EREGL (1W: +8.93% | 1M: +21.65%) ABOVE TREND; ALARK (1W: +8.77% | 1M: +12.64%) ABOVE TREND; ARCLK (1W: +8.43% | 1M: +14.19%) ABOVE TREND; THYAO (1W: +7.77% | 1M: +13.04%) ABOVE TREND. These names show confirmed momentum across both timeframes.

**5. Worst Performing Stocks?**
TOASO (1W: -1.17% | 1M: +14.86%) CORRECTION; YKBNK (1W: -1.54% | 1M: +5.47%) CORRECTION; TRALT (1W: -1.75% | 1M: +8.97%) CORRECTION; GARAN (1W: -1.81% | 1M: +8.04%) CORRECTION; DOHOL (1W: -2.33% | 1M: +13.27%) CORRECTION. Losses are shallow and mostly short-term pullbacks inside bullish 1M trends.

**6. Momentum Stocks?**
Highest 1W movers: TKFEN (1W: +11.99% | 1M: +17.36%) ABOVE TREND; EREGL (1W: +8.93% | 1M: +21.65%) ABOVE TREND; ALARK (1W: +8.77% | 1M: +12.64%) ABOVE TREND; ARCLK (1W: +8.43% | 1M: +14.19%) ABOVE TREND; THYAO (1W: +7.77% | 1M: +13.04%) ABOVE TREND. Momentum is concentrated in cyclicals and exporters.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

**7. Banking Sector Outlook?**
Banks are mixed-to-weak on the week; ISCTR (1W: +0.83% | 1M: +17.35%) ABOVE TREND while AKBNK (1W: -6.05% | 1M: +15.79%) CORRECTION and GARAN (1W: -1.81% | 1M: +8.04%) CORRECTION are under pressure. TSKB (1W: -2.55% | 1M: -1.40%) BELOW TREND signals selective risk in smaller bank names.

**8. Industrial Sector Outlook?**
Heavy industry shows broad strength led by EREGL (1W: +8.93% | 1M: +21.65%) ABOVE TREND and FROTO (1W: +4.92% | 1M: +21.28%) ABOVE TREND, supporting cyclical exposure. Defense and select autos show short-term pauses: ASELS (1W: -2.50% | 1M: +4.29%) CORRECTION and TOASO (1W: -1.17% | 1M: +14.86%) CORRECTION.

**9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?**
Energy & Chemicals are constructive overall but mixed: SISE (1W: +6.44% | 1M: +23.10%) ABOVE TREND and GUBRF (1W: +6.97% | 1M: +38.23%) ABOVE TREND lead, while TUPRS (1W: -4.27% | 1M: +11.40%) CORRECTION and TRALT (1W: -1.75% | 1M: +8.97%) CORRECTION require monitoring for commodity sensitivity. Expect sector moves to track oil/chemical spreads and export demand.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

**10. Portfolio Recommendation?**
Overweight cyclical leaders in Construction, Transportation and Retail while trimming lagging bank/holding exposure; maintain size discipline on names up sharply. Use pullbacks in strong names (EREGL, TKFEN, SISE) to add and avoid chasing AKBNK-style one-week capitulations.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

**11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?**
TKFEN (1W: +11.99% | 1M: +17.36%) ABOVE TREND for follow-through momentum; EREGL (1W: +8.93% | 1M: +21.65%) ABOVE TREND for cyclicals; TUPRS (1W: -4.27% | 1M: +11.40%) CORRECTION for commodity/earnings sensitivity; AKBNK (1W: -6.05% | 1M: +15.79%) CORRECTION as a liquidity/flow monitor. These will signal whether rotation or broadening of the rally continues.

**12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?**
Construction & REIT and Transportation for leadership confirmation, and Banking for signs of mean-reversion or further risk-off within financials. Momentum in Energy (SISE/GUBRF) will be a key tell on commodity-driven upside.

**13. Key Levels & Triggers?**
Watch XU100 reaction around near-term technical support/resistance and domestic liquidity flows; catalysts include Turkish monetary policy commentary, FX moves, oil and global risk sentiment. Monitor corporate earnings/updates from large caps and weekly foreign flows as triggers for rotation or profit-taking.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Risk-on market with low volatility and broad sector participation; cyclicals (Construction, Heavy Industry, Transportation, Retail) lead while banks and holdings lag. Opportunity: add proven momentum on pullbacks; risk: concentrated one-week reversals in financials and commodity-sensitive names.
